body:
Comment 5 by **scott+ctt@pakin.org**: 
Thanks; I will indeed fix my code.

Nevertheless, that part of my last message was an aside.  I still argue that if a
package defines types Foo and Bar as well as a (non-method) function that returns both a
Foo and a Bar, then godoc should list that function at the top level, not indented
beneath the Foo or Bar type.
